bio.p: Namrta Choudhry obtained her Ph.D. in Botany (major Pharmacognosy) from the Aligarh Muslim University, Aligarh, and in collaboration with the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research- NBRI, Lucknow India in 2015, later she joined a project entitled ‘World Herbal Encyclopedia’ at Patanjali Research Institute, Haridwar India. Her main research interests focus on the standardizing of medicinal herbs and focus on bioactive plantderived compounds for therapeutic uses. Since 2018, she has been working as a postdoctoral fellow to study the effect of terpenoids on the IAV and CoVs at the College of Veterinary Medicine, South China Agricultural University in Guangzhou, China.
